11635754: Director Oliver Stone expresses admiration for Indian cinema, citing its vitality and versatility, and considers making a movie in India if he finds a great story.

39815663: The European Union is seeking to relocate euro clearing operations from London to the EU, potentially disrupting the global financial system and threatening thousands of UK jobs.
39898482: Tottenham Hotspur's Son Heung-Min won the Premier League Player of the Month award for April, scoring five of the team's 16 goals during a six-game winning streak.
39984637: Prince's estate is embroiled in a legal battle over his $200m fortune, with 45 claimants seeking a share, including a prisoner who falsely claimed to be his son.
39995133: World-ranked 10th fencer Alexander Kruse won the foil event in Shanghai, defeating Italy's Alessio Foconi 15-8, and will rise to world number five with the victory.
40032656: South Wales Police closed Swansea's Indoor Market and bus station due to a suspect package report, but reopened areas before 17:00 BST after investigating the incident.
40054265: US President Trump is expected to withdraw from the Paris climate agreement, driven by economic nationalists, movement conservatives, and his working-class supporters, despite opposition from his daughter Ivanka and other advisors.
40107476: The National Railway Museum has donated Locomotive No 563, a historic 1893 steam engine, to the Swanage Railway for restoration and potential return to steam.
40123819: Leicester Tigers sign four new players, including Tonga's Kalamafoni and Ireland's Ryan, from Gloucester and Yorkshire Carnegie, respectively, to strengthen their squad.
40178965: Sunderland striker Jermain Defoe reflects on his close bond with six-year-old Bradley Lowery, who has a terminal illness and is receiving palliative care at home.
40221674: Macclesfield Town has signed several players, including Hodgkiss, Wilson, Pilkington, and Fitzpatrick, while manager Askey has extended his contract for another season.
40249088: Ineos plans to increase its ethylene and propylene production in Europe by 50% through new investments in Scotland and Norway, creating 300 new jobs over the next three to four years.
40339241: Adele surprised firefighters at a Chelsea fire station with a visit and a cup of tea, showing her support for those affected by the Grenfell Tower fire.
40547658: Olivier Ntcham has signed a four-year contract with Celtic, citing a desire to play regular first-team football and mirror the success of compatriot Moussa Dembele.
40548717: Sierra Leonean goalkeeper Alhaji Conteh, 25, has died, reportedly due to poor health, despite being part of the national team's squad for the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations.
40564245: The FBI is investigating the Trump campaign's potential ties to Russia, focusing on Donald Trump Jr.'s meeting with a Russian lawyer and emails suggesting the campaign sought damaging information on Hillary Clinton.
40636168: Ryan Giggs, former Manchester United player and coach, is enjoying his year off from football, but hasn't ruled out managing Wales or returning to the sport in the future.
40694542: Crystal Palace's Wilfried Zaha posted on Instagram about being racially abused by Manchester United and Liverpool fans, following a 2-0 win over West Brom.
40774469: The Battle of Passchendaele, fought from July to November 1917, resulted in the deaths, disappearances, or wounding of over 500,000 Allied and German soldiers.
40848302: Visitors to the Anglesey Eisteddfod festival were asked to take shuttle buses due to muddy conditions at the Maes, with some waiting up to two hours for a bus.
40975362: Juventus won 3-0 against Cagliari, with Mario Mandzukic, Paulo Dybala, and Gonzalo Higuaín scoring, as they continued their pursuit of a seventh consecutive Serie A title.
41028780: Mick Schumacher, 18, will drive a 1994 Benetton car in demonstration laps, following in his father Michael's footsteps, who won his first race at the circuit in 1992.
